title: How to Make Salad Dressing

steps.headline: Blend the first four ingredients.
steps.description: Whisk the egg yolks, salt, powdered sugar, and lemon juice together by hand or using an electric mixer. You could also use a blender or food processor instead of an electric mixer. Only use the egg yolks for this recipe, not the entire egg. Separate the yolks by capturing them in their shells as the egg whites drain or by running them through an egg separator.

steps.headline: Slowly drizzle in 1 cup (250 ml) oil.
steps.description: Whisk or blend thoroughly to combine. Add the oil in a slow, steady stream to prevent the texture from turning clumpy. Pour the oil in through the hole in the lid of your food processor or blender. If using a whisk or electric mixer, hold the bowl steady by keeping a dish towel under it. Use one hand to pour the oil and the other to blend or whisk it in.

steps.headline: Gradually add the remaining 1/2 cup (125 ml) of oil.
steps.description: Blend after each addition to incorporate the remaining oil before adding more. As before, you need to make sure the oil gets blended in fairly consistently as you add it.

steps.headline: Add 2 Tbsp (30 ml) of vinegar.
steps.description: Whisk or blend the vinegar in, combining well. This is essentially a simple mayonnaise. Set the mixture aside and press on with the rest of the dressing.

steps.headline: Mix the cornstarch, dry mustard, and remaining vinegar in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Whisk the ingredients together rapidly until well combined. You do not need a food processor, blender, or electric mixer for this step.

steps.headline: Boil 1 cup (250 ml) water in a small saucepan.
steps.description: Heat the water over medium-high heat for a few minutes until it reaches a boil. Add the cornstarch mixture and cook. Stir or whisk the mixture continuously as it cooks. Continue cooking until the mixture has a smooth, pudding-like consistency. Do not let it get thicker than this.

steps.headline: Slowly add the hot cornstarch mixture to the mayonnaise mixture.
steps.description: Blend or whisk well to combine. You can either whisk the mixture by hand or use your blender, food processor, or electric mixer.

steps.headline: Fold in the paprika and garlic powder.
steps.description: Sprinkle these seasonings into the dressing and gently mix them in with a spoon or spatula to incorporate them.

steps.headline: Store the dressing in an airtight container.
steps.description: Let it cool inside the refrigerator before using. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week.

methods.name:
Poppy Seed Dressing[1]
	X
		Research source

steps.headline: Combine the mayonnaise, honey, and mustard.
steps.description: In a small to medium mixing bowl, combine the three ingredients and rapidly whisk them together until the color and consistency are even throughout. Make sure the color is even and solid. There should be no yellow or white streaks running through the mixture. This dressing is simple enough to prepare by hand, so you do not need to use a food processor or bender.

steps.headline: Gently stir in the poppy seeds.
steps.description: Sprinkle the poppy seeds over the surface of the dressing mixture and stir the mixture until the seeds are evenly distributed. The flecks of poppy seed should be dispersed throughout the mixture.

steps.headline: Add the salt and pepper.
steps.description: Sprinkle in the salt and pepper, adjusting the seasonings to taste, and stir the mixture well to distribute the seasonings evenly.

steps.headline: Chill until ready to use.
steps.description: You can use the dressing immediately, but if you made it ahead of time, place the poppy seed salad dressing in an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week.

methods.name:
Red Wine Vinaigrette[2]
	X
		Research source

steps.headline: Blend the vinegar, lemon juice, honey, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Add the ingredients to a small bowl or food processor and whisk or blend rapidly to combine them evenly. Using a food processor or blender can make it easier to stir in the oil later, but the dressing can be prepared easily by hand.

steps.headline: Gradually blend in the oil.
steps.description: Pour the oil into the dressing in a slow, steady stream, whisking or blending it as you make the addition. Continue until all the oil has been added. If using a food processor or blender, add the oil through the hole in the lid as the machine blends the ingredients together. If mixing by hand, place a towel underneath the bowl to prevent it from sliding around as you whisk the ingredients together.

steps.headline: Keep chilled until ready to use.
steps.description: You can use the dressing immediately, but if you made it ahead of time, place the poppy seed salad dressing in an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week.

steps.headline: Whisk together the picante sauce, chili powder, and cumin.
steps.description: Combine the ingredients in a bowl and rapidly whisk them together until evenly combined. Since this is such a simple salad dressing, you do not need to use a blender or food processor. In fact, the heat from the machine could melt the sour cream as you blend it, causing the dressing to turn soupy and gloppy.

steps.headline: Combine with the sour cream.
steps.description: Stir the sour cream into the existing ingredients until it is thoroughly blended. You will know the sour cream has been blended in based on the color of the dressing. Once there are no longer any red or white streaks, the color is even, and solid, the ingredients have been blended sufficiently.

steps.headline: Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
steps.description: You can use the dressing immediately, but if you made it ahead of time, place the poppy seed salad dressing in an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week.

steps.headline: Make a simple vinaigrette.
steps.description: All vinaigrettes are a mixture of oil, vinegar, a seasoning, and a sweetener. Play with different vinegars and seasonings to find the perfect dressing for you. Try your hand at making balsamic vinaigrette. This dressing can be prepared with oil, balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Mix up a sweet strawberry dressing. Strawberry vinaigrette can be made by combining berry vinegar and olive oil with cornstarch, black pepper, and fresh strawberries. Opt for a simple citrus vinaigrette. You can make a lemon vinaigrette or a lime vinaigrette by simply replacing the vinegar usually used with lemon juice or lime juice, respectively.

steps.headline: Prepare French salad dressing.
steps.description: French style salad dressing can be made by whisking together corn oil, vinegar, ketchup, sugar, and seasoning.

steps.headline: Whip up a batch of ranch dressing.
steps.description: Ranch dressing is a simple combination of mayonnaise, buttermilk, salt, garlic salt, pepper, and dill weed.

steps.headline: Try making your own Italian salad dressing.
steps.description: Italian dressings contain various spices and seasonings, including sugar, dry mustard, salt, garlic, red pepper, black pepper, oregano, onion powder, and paprika. Combine these spices with vinegar and water to make your dressing.

steps.headline: Make Russian salad dressing.
steps.description: Russian salad dressing is similar to French dressing, but it tends to be a little spicier. Whisk together mayonnaise, ketchup, onion, vinegar, and hot sauce.

steps.headline: Prepare a variation of thousand island dressing.
steps.description: There are multiple ways to make this dressing, but most generally involve the use of mayonnaise, ketchup, vinegar, sugar, and pickle relish.

steps.headline: Try making a simple blue cheese dressing.
steps.description: Blue cheese dressing can be made by mixing mayonnaise, blue cheese, half-and-half, and hot sauce.

steps.headline: Create a classic Caesar dressing.
steps.description: The perfect dressing for a Caesar salad can be made by combining Dijon mustard, anchovies, garlic, egg yolk, lemon juice, and olive oil.

steps.headline: Experiment with a tangy, creamy mustard dressing.
steps.description: You can make a quick and flavorful salad dressing by combining Dijon mustard, cream, honey, salt, pepper, and herbs.

steps.headline: Enchant your tastebuds with miso salad dressing.
steps.description: For an Asian-inspired miso dressing, mix miso paste, Dijon mustard, water, lemon juice, olive oil, ginger, and chopped scallion.

steps.headline: Taste something different by making a sesame seed dressing.
steps.description: This is another Asian-inspired salad dressing. You can prepare it by mixing ground, toasted sesame seeds, dashi, soy sauce, and sugar.

steps.headline: Delight friends and family with a toasted garlic salad dressing.
steps.description: Combine balsamic vinegar with dried basil, dried tarragon, lemon zest, oregano, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, and toasted garlic.

tyn: Blender, food processor, or electric mixer
text:
Miracle Whip Dressing Substitute Blend the first four ingredients. Whisk the egg yolks, salt, powdered sugar, and lemon juice together by hand or using an electric mixer. You could also use a blender or food processor instead of an electric mixer. Only use the egg yolks for this recipe, not the entire egg. Separate the yolks by capturing them in their shells as the egg whites drain or by running them through an egg separator. Slowly drizzle in 1 cup (250 ml) oil. Whisk or blend thoroughly to combine. Add the oil in a slow, steady stream to prevent the texture from turning clumpy. Pour the oil in through the hole in the lid of your food processor or blender. If using a whisk or electric mixer, hold the bowl steady by keeping a dish towel under it. Use one hand to pour the oil and the other to blend or whisk it in. Gradually add the remaining 1/2 cup (125 ml) of oil. Blend after each addition to incorporate the remaining oil before adding more. As before, you need to make sure the oil gets blended in fairly consistently as you add it. Add 2 Tbsp (30 ml) of vinegar. Whisk or blend the vinegar in, combining well. This is essentially a simple mayonnaise. Set the mixture aside and press on with the rest of the dressing. Mix the cornstarch, dry mustard, and remaining vinegar in a separate bowl. Whisk the ingredients together rapidly until well combined. You do not need a food processor, blender, or electric mixer for this step. Boil 1 cup (250 ml) water in a small saucepan. Heat the water over medium-high heat for a few minutes until it reaches a boil. Add the cornstarch mixture and cook. Stir or whisk the mixture continuously as it cooks. Continue cooking until the mixture has a smooth, pudding-like consistency. Do not let it get thicker than this. Slowly add the hot cornstarch mixture to the mayonnaise mixture. Blend or whisk well to combine. You can either whisk the mixture by hand or use your blender, food processor, or electric mixer. Fold in the paprika and garlic powder. Sprinkle these seasonings into the dressing and gently mix them in with a spoon or spatula to incorporate them. Store the dressing in an airtight container. Let it cool inside the refrigerator before using. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week. Poppy Seed Dressing[1]

		Research source Combine the mayonnaise, honey, and mustard. In a small to medium mixing bowl, combine the three ingredients and rapidly whisk them together until the color and consistency are even throughout. Make sure the color is even and solid. There should be no yellow or white streaks running through the mixture. This dressing is simple enough to prepare by hand, so you do not need to use a food processor or bender. Gently stir in the poppy seeds. Sprinkle the poppy seeds over the surface of the dressing mixture and stir the mixture until the seeds are evenly distributed. The flecks of poppy seed should be dispersed throughout the mixture. Add the salt and pepper. Sprinkle in the salt and pepper, adjusting the seasonings to taste, and stir the mixture well to distribute the seasonings evenly. Chill until ready to use. You can use the dressing immediately, but if you made it ahead of time, place the poppy seed salad dressing in an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week. Red Wine Vinaigrette[2]

Using a food processor or blender can make it easier to stir in the oil later, but the dressing can be prepared easily by hand. Gradually blend in the oil. Pour the oil into the dressing in a slow, steady stream, whisking or blending it as you make the addition. Continue until all the oil has been added. If using a food processor or blender, add the oil through the hole in the lid as the machine blends the ingredients together. If mixing by hand, place a towel underneath the bowl to prevent it from sliding around as you whisk the ingredients together. Keep chilled until ready to use. You can use the dressing immediately, but if you made it ahead of time, place the poppy seed salad dressing in an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week. Southwest Dressing[3]
	X
		Research source Whisk together the picante sauce, chili powder, and cumin. Combine the ingredients in a bowl and rapidly whisk them together until evenly combined. Since this is such a simple salad dressing, you do not need to use a blender or food processor. In fact, the heat from the machine could melt the sour cream as you blend it, causing the dressing to turn soupy and gloppy. Combine with the sour cream. Stir the sour cream into the existing ingredients until it is thoroughly blended. You will know the sour cream has been blended in based on the color of the dressing. Once there are no longer any red or white streaks, the color is even, and solid, the ingredients have been blended sufficiently. Store in the refrigerator until ready to use. You can use the dressing immediately, but if you made it ahead of time, place the poppy seed salad dressing in an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use. It should stay fresh for a few days to a week. Additional Salad Dressing Recipes Make a simple vinaigrette. All vinaigrettes are a mixture of oil, vinegar, a seasoning, and a sweetener. Play with different vinegars and seasonings to find the perfect dressing for you. Try your hand at making balsamic vinaigrette. This dressing can be prepared with oil, balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Mix up a sweet strawberry dressing. Strawberry vinaigrette can be made by combining berry vinegar and olive oil with cornstarch, black pepper, and fresh strawberries. Opt for a simple citrus vinaigrette. You can make a lemon vinaigrette or a lime vinaigrette by simply replacing the vinegar usually used with lemon juice or lime juice, respectively. Prepare French salad dressing. French style salad dressing can be made by whisking together corn oil, vinegar, ketchup, sugar, and seasoning. Whip up a batch of ranch dressing. Ranch dressing is a simple combination of mayonnaise, buttermilk, salt, garlic salt, pepper, and dill weed. Try making your own Italian salad dressing. Italian dressings contain various spices and seasonings, including sugar, dry mustard, salt, garlic, red pepper, black pepper, oregano, onion powder, and paprika. Combine these spices with vinegar and water to make your dressing. Make Russian salad dressing. Russian salad dressing is similar to French dressing, but it tends to be a little spicier. Whisk together mayonnaise, ketchup, onion, vinegar, and hot sauce. Prepare a variation of thousand island dressing. There are multiple ways to make this dressing, but most generally involve the use of mayonnaise, ketchup, vinegar, sugar, and pickle relish. Try making a simple blue cheese dressing. Blue cheese dressing can be made by mixing mayonnaise, blue cheese, half-and-half, and hot sauce. Create a classic Caesar dressing. The perfect dressing for a Caesar salad can be made by combining Dijon mustard, anchovies, garlic, egg yolk, lemon juice, and olive oil. Experiment with a tangy, creamy mustard dressing. You can make a quick and flavorful salad dressing by combining Dijon mustard, cream, honey, salt, pepper, and herbs. Enchant your tastebuds with miso salad dressing. For an Asian-inspired miso dressing, mix miso paste, Dijon mustard, water, lemon juice, olive oil, ginger, and chopped scallion. Taste something different by making a sesame seed dressing. This is another Asian-inspired salad dressing. You can prepare it by mixing ground, toasted sesame seeds, dashi, soy sauce, and sugar. Delight friends and family with a toasted garlic salad dressing. Combine balsamic vinegar with dried basil, dried tarragon, lemon zest, oregano, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, and toasted garlic.
sentences: Miracle Whip Dressing Substitute Blend the first four ingredients.
Whisk the egg yolks, salt, powdered sugar, and lemon juice together by hand or using an electric mixer.
You could also use a blender or food processor instead of an electric mixer.
Only use the egg yolks for this recipe, not the entire egg.
Separate the yolks by capturing them in their shells as the egg whites drain or by running them through an egg separator.
Slowly drizzle in 1 cup (250 ml) oil.
Whisk or blend thoroughly to combine.
Add the oil in a slow, steady stream to prevent the texture from turning clumpy.
Pour the oil in through the hole in the lid of your food processor or blender.
If using a whisk or electric mixer, hold the bowl steady by keeping a dish towel under it.
Use one hand to pour the oil and the other to blend or whisk it in.
Gradually add the remaining 1/2 cup (125 ml) of oil.
Blend after each addition to incorporate the remaining oil before adding more.
As before, you need to make sure the oil gets blended in fairly consistently as you add it.
Add 2 Tbsp (30 ml) of vinegar.
Whisk or blend the vinegar in, combining well.
This is essentially a simple mayonnaise.
Set the mixture aside and press on with the rest of the dressing.
Mix the cornstarch, dry mustard, and remaining vinegar in a separate bowl.
Whisk the ingredients together rapidly until well combined.
You do not need a food processor, blender, or electric mixer for this step.
Boil 1 cup (250 ml) water in a small saucepan.
Heat the water over medium-high heat for a few minutes until it reaches a boil.
Add the cornstarch mixture and cook.
Stir or whisk the mixture continuously as it cooks.
Continue cooking until the mixture has a smooth, pudding-like consistency.
Do not let it get thicker than this.
Slowly add the hot cornstarch mixture to the mayonnaise mixture.
Blend or whisk well to combine.
You can either whisk the mixture by hand or use your blender, food processor, or electric mixer.
Fold in the paprika and garlic powder.
Sprinkle these seasonings into the dressing and gently mix them in with a spoon or spatula to incorporate them.
Store the dressing in an airtight container.
Let it cool inside the refrigerator before using.
Store the dressing inside the refrigerator when not in use.
It should stay fresh for a few days to a week.

Poppy Seed Dressing[1]

This dressing is simple enough to prepare by hand, so you do not need to use a food processor or bender.
Gently stir in the poppy seeds.

Additional Salad Dressing Recipes Make a simple vinaigrette.
All vinaigrettes are a mixture of oil, vinegar, a seasoning, and a sweetener.
Play with different vinegars and seasonings to find the perfect dressing for you.
Try your hand at making balsamic vinaigrette.
This dressing can be prepared with oil, balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Mix up a sweet strawberry dressing.
Strawberry vinaigrette can be made by combining berry vinegar and olive oil with cornstarch, black pepper, and fresh strawberries.
Opt for a simple citrus vinaigrette.
You can make a lemon vinaigrette or a lime vinaigrette by simply replacing the vinegar usually used with lemon juice or lime juice, respectively.
Prepare French salad dressing.
French style salad dressing can be made by whisking together corn oil, vinegar, ketchup, sugar, and seasoning.
Whip up a batch of ranch dressing.
Ranch dressing is a simple combination of mayonnaise, buttermilk, salt, garlic salt, pepper, and dill weed.
Try making your own Italian salad dressing.
Italian dressings contain various spices and seasonings, including sugar, dry mustard, salt, garlic, red pepper, black pepper, oregano, onion powder, and paprika.
Combine these spices with vinegar and water to make your dressing.
Make Russian salad dressing.
Russian salad dressing is similar to French dressing, but it tends to be a little spicier.
Whisk together mayonnaise, ketchup, onion, vinegar, and hot sauce.
Prepare a variation of thousand island dressing.
There are multiple ways to make this dressing, but most generally involve the use of mayonnaise, ketchup, vinegar, sugar, and pickle relish.
Try making a simple blue cheese dressing.
Blue cheese dressing can be made by mixing mayonnaise, blue cheese, half-and-half, and hot sauce.
Create a classic Caesar dressing.
The perfect dressing for a Caesar salad can be made by combining Dijon mustard, anchovies, garlic, egg yolk, lemon juice, and olive oil.
Experiment with a tangy, creamy mustard dressing.
You can make a quick and flavorful salad dressing by combining Dijon mustard, cream, honey, salt, pepper, and herbs.
Enchant your tastebuds with miso salad dressing.
For an Asian-inspired miso dressing, mix miso paste, Dijon mustard, water, lemon juice, olive oil, ginger, and chopped scallion.
Taste something different by making a sesame seed dressing.
This is another Asian-inspired salad dressing.
You can prepare it by mixing ground, toasted sesame seeds, dashi, soy sauce, and sugar.
Delight friends and family with a toasted garlic salad dressing.
Combine balsamic vinegar with dried basil, dried tarragon, lemon zest, oregano, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, and toasted garlic.
